definition: to pass water/to piss/to urinate/to wee wee
to let go/to cast/to let loose/to discharge/to give expression to

sentences.english: He urinates, you give him a treat.
sentences.chinese: 它撒尿了，你会为它做处理。

sentences.english: Local says, stand in the street here piddle , can grow across on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 当地人说，站在街这边撒尿，可以滋到对面墙上。

sentences.english: A man who likes peeing against the wind has no right to complain about his cleaning bills.
sentences.chinese: 一个喜欢对着风撒尿的人没有资格抱怨自己交易单。

sentences.english: Some even argue that squatting is a more natural position for 1) urination and 2) well, number two.
sentences.chinese: 一些人甚至说对撒尿来说蹲姿是一种更自然的姿式。

sentences.english: The old man then stepped into the neighboring stall and urinated.
sentences.chinese: 随后老人走进边上的那个隔段里撒尿。

sentences.english: Instead, it makes noise, it pees, poos and barfs.
sentences.chinese: 它会制造噪音，撒尿拉屎，甚至生病呕吐。

sentences.english: Even children's lunch-box fruit-juice packets are sufficient, he added.
sentences.chinese: 甚至儿童的饭盒，果汁包足够他撒尿了。

sentences.english: One of the guests urinated on a neighbour’s doorstep.
sentences.chinese: 一个她邀请的客人还在邻居门前的台阶上撒尿。

sentences.english: Maybe all this started when I peed on the Blarney stone.
sentences.chinese: 也许一切始于我在布拉尼之石上撒尿。

sentences.english: Students scrambled to the Diet and urinated on the doors.
sentences.chinese: 学生们争夺配餐，在门廊上撒尿。

sentences.english: And the first time a man had peed in front of her.
sentences.chinese: 可你还是那个在我身上撒尿的人。

sentences.english: Chandler: Then put out fire by peeing, no get invited back.
sentences.chinese: 然后撒尿熄火，从此成为拒绝往来户。

sentences.english: After the child urinates , on the paper diaper will also have the red small blood spot.
sentences.chinese: 孩子撒尿后，纸尿布上也会有红色的小血点。

sentences.english: Send a text message only containing your pee-set remote control code to your phone.
sentences.chinese: 发送短信息只包含您撒尿集远程控制代码到您的手机。

sentences.english: Without good education , she piddled everywhere in the room.
sentences.chinese: 也没有教育好，到处拉屎撒尿。

definition: to pee pee (kiddie or feminine slang)
to relieve oneself (i.e. use the toilet)/to solve
to support a child (or invalid etc) while he or she urinates
to defecate (euphemism)/to go to the toilet
Turkish toilet/squat toilet/to vacate one's bowels
to fart/to break wind/to talk nonsense/Utter rubbish!
